result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adagio J Torres

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adagio J Torres in court.  Attorney Michael G. Levine in court for Adagio J Torres.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours to the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 09:00 am.
for Withdrawal of Counsel and Notice of Completion, signed and filed.

Defendant Adagio J Torres appeared by video.  Attorney Michael G. Levine appeared by video for Adagio J Torres.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense has received discovery, offer read into the record by the State. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adagio J Torres in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Case in Court for Final Pretrial.  Defense adjournment of the jury trial. Court grants request and vacates the scheduled jury trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Stipulation for Substitution of Attorneys, received and filed

Adjustment Number: 22A 075222,
Payable Number: 1024244,
Receipt Number: 22RP031417,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Adagio J Torres in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adagio J Torres appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for status conference. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 30. Final pretrial is scheduled on August 12, 2022 at 1:30pm. Jury trial is scheduled on August 29, 2022 at 9:00am.

Defendant Adagio J Torres in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adagio J Torres appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for status conference. Defense has not received discorery and an offer. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 30. Status Conference is scheduled on May 19, 2022 at 01:30pm.

Defendant Adagio J Torres in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adagio J Torres appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Confernce held.  Defense counsel requests status conference by zoom.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RSC
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Adagio J Torres in court.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/2/22 @ 2p
